comments.body:
As @escowles points out above, the key is the the EAD container and the MODS shelfLocator.  With a few regular expressions in XQuery, I was able to match every container with a METS and, therefore, a path to an image.  Next step is to use that data in a bulk ingest:

1. Ingest TIFFs
2. Obtain ark
3. Update EAD with `<dao>` elements

comments.body: Most of the files that are missing are just in newly named folders because Dan manually ingested them into Figgy. We can just not worry about those. There are a few early ones (mostly ones from 2002) that are legitimately missing. I've sent the list of all the missing files to Dan to work out.

lux.title: Add submenu option to MenuBar component

comments.body:
It looks like we have a `parent` option to have visually nested dropdowns, but we need to structure the html to be nested. They currently render as sibling elements. ```
  • Vegetable
  • - Lettuce
  • - Carrot
  • Fruit
  • - Apple
  • - Pear
``` @sdellis instead of menuItems having parents, do we want to be allow for them to have children? Instead of ``` {name: 'Apple', component: 'Apple', parent: 'Fruit'}, {name: 'Kiwi', component: 'Kiwi', parent: 'Fruit'} ``` do this ``` {name: 'Fruit', component: 'Fruit', children: [ {name: 'Apple', component: 'Apple', href: '/apples'}, {name: 'Kiwi', component: 'Kiwi', href: '/kiwis'}, ]'},

lux.title: Refactors parent menuItem attribute to be children instead
